dialogue.text: Sometimes I meet people who've 'found themselves.' I smile, knowing they've just paused the question temporarily.
I finally found myself! Three months of soul-searching, and now I know exactly who I amâ€”a visionary disruption catalyst!
I help people discover their authentic selves. Find Your True Identity in 30 Days.
But we need to know who we are to succeed!
What if success means dancing gracefully with not knowing?
I thought I was the only one who still didn't know who I was.

visual_elements.evan_position: Back of room observer, gentle outsider

psychological_notes: Evan demonstrates mature compassion for those seeking fixed identity. He recognizes their answers as temporary pauses in eternal questioning. No need to destabilize others - the question returns naturally. Shows how certainty-seeking is collective defense against existential anxiety.
philosophical_underpinning: All identity is provisional; the question outlasts every answer
therapeutic_direction: Compassion for necessary illusions while maintaining deeper truth
